subject: Gardening
title: Root Navigation Intelligence
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Root Navigation Intelligence.

hook.text: Roots don't just grow down. They navigate around obstacles, toward water, and away from toxinsâ€”simultaneously.

buildup.text: A root tip integrates signals from gravity, moisture, nutrients, light, touch, and neighboring roots.

discovery.text: Charles Darwin proposed that root tips function like 'the brain of a lower animal'â€”directing the whole plant.

twist.text: Each root tip makes independent decisions. A single plant runs thousands of parallel navigation systems at once.

climax.text: Root intelligence is distributed, not centralized. It resembles a swarm more than a single mind.

punchline.text: Every root tip is an independent decision-maker.

quiz.question: How did Darwin describe the function of root tips?
options: As simple growth appendages with no sensory role
As functioning like 'the brain of a lower animal'
